brief_description: Gliomas are diverse neoplasms with multiple molecular subtypes. How tumor-initiating mutations relate to molecular subtypes as these tumors evolve during malignant progression remains unclear. We used genetically-engineered mouse models, histopathology, genetic lineage tracing, expression profiling, and copy number analyses to examine how genomic tumor diversity evolves during the course of malignant progression from low-to high-grade disease.
description: Gliomas are diverse neoplasms with multiple molecular subtypes. How tumor-initiating mutations relate to molecular subtypes as these tumors evolve during malignant progression remains unclear. We used genetically-engineered mouse models, histopathology, genetic lineage tracing, expression profiling, and copy number analyses to examine how genomic tumor diversity evolves during the course of malignant progression from low-to high-grade disease.
endpoints: gene expression profiles (Agilent array), CNV from cGH array, and MRI images for tracing tumor progression.
hypothesis: The genetic requirements during tumor progression from low- to high- grade and heterogenity gliomas can be achieved through genomic analysis on a series of inducible GEM models in oncogenic driver mutations. The GEM models with the similar genetic alterations as in the human gliomas could drive the similar malignant progression; CNA may be a consequence of Kras-G12D inducibe malignant progression; p53 deletion contributed to the difference between genomic landscapes in these models.
objectives: Expanded on our previous work with a series of conditional, inducible GEM models in which the MAPK and/or PI3K effector arms of RTK signaling are mutationally activated in G1/S checkpoint-defective adult mouse astrocytes. We use this model system here to examine the genetic requirements for tumorigenesis within G1/S and MAPK pathways and the genomics of tumor evolution during progression from low- to high-grade disease, and validate subsequent hypothesis in other GEM models and human tumor xenografts in mouse.
official_title: Genomic profiles of low-grade murine gliomas evolve during progression to glioblastoma

arm.description: human glioblastoma xenograft in mouse (orthotopic tumors)
arm.name: Hum_GBM Xenograft

pubmed.title: Genomic profiles of low-grade murine gliomas evolve during progression to glioblastoma.

program.program_name: Enhance Applicability of Mouse Models for Translational Research (Oncology Model, OMF)
program.contract_name: Credentialing Murine Models For Glioblastoma Preclinical Drug Development (Oncology Model, OMF)
